   20: -module(seq_trace_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: -export([token_set_get/1, tracer_set_get/1, print/1,
   26:          old_heap_token/1,mature_heap_token/1,
   27: 	 send/1, distributed_send/1, recv/1, distributed_recv/1,
   28: 	 trace_exit/1, distributed_exit/1, call/1, port/1,
   29:          port_clean_token/1,
   30: 	 match_set_seq_token/1, gc_seq_token/1,
   31:          send_literal/1,inherit_on_spawn/1,inherit_on_dist_spawn/1,
   32:          dist_spawn_error/1]).
   33: 
   34: %% internal exports
   35: -export([simple_tracer/2, one_time_receiver/0, one_time_receiver/1,
   36:          n_time_receiver/1,
   37: 	 start_tracer/0, stop_tracer/1, 
   38: 	 do_match_set_seq_token/1, do_gc_seq_token/1, countdown_start/2]).
   39: 
   40: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   41: 
   42: -define(TIMESTAMP_MODES, [no_timestamp,
   43: 			  timestamp,
   44: 			  monotonic_timestamp,
   45: 			  strict_monotonic_timestamp]).
   46: 
   47: suite() ->
   48:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   49:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   50: 
   51: all() -> 
   52:     [token_set_get, tracer_set_get, print, send, send_literal,
   53:      distributed_send, recv, distributed_recv, trace_exit,
   54:      old_heap_token, mature_heap_token,
   55:      distributed_exit, call, port, match_set_seq_token,
   56:      port_clean_token,
   57:      gc_seq_token,
   58:      inherit_on_spawn, inherit_on_dist_spawn, dist_spawn_error].
   59: 
   60: groups() -> 
   61:     [].
   62: 
   63: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   64:     os:internal_init_cmd_shell(),
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   68:     ok.
   69: 
   70: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   71:     Config.
   72: 
   73: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   74:     Config.
   75: 
   76: 
   77: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   78:     Config.
   79: 
   80: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   81:     ok.
   82: 
   83: %% Verifies that the set_token and get_token functions work as expected
   84: 
   85: token_set_get(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   86:     do_token_set_get(timestamp),
   87:     do_token_set_get(monotonic_timestamp),
   88:     do_token_set_get(strict_monotonic_timestamp).
   89: 
   90: -define(SEQ_TRACE_SEND, 1).                     %(1 << 0)
   91: -define(SEQ_TRACE_RECEIVE, 2).                  %(1 << 1)
   92: -define(SEQ_TRACE_PRINT, 4).                    %(1 << 2)
   93: -define(SEQ_TRACE_NOW_TIMESTAMP, 8).            %(1 << 3)
   94: -define(SEQ_TRACE_STRICT_MON_TIMESTAMP, 16).    %(1 << 4)
   95: -define(SEQ_TRACE_MON_TIMESTAMP, 32).           %(1 << 5)
   96: 
   97: do_token_set_get(TsType) ->
   98:     BaseOpts = ?SEQ_TRACE_SEND bor
   99:                ?SEQ_TRACE_RECEIVE bor
  100:                ?SEQ_TRACE_PRINT,
  101:     Flags = case TsType of
  102:         timestamp ->
  103:             BaseOpts bor ?SEQ_TRACE_NOW_TIMESTAMP;
  104:         strict_monotonic_timestamp ->
  105:             BaseOpts bor ?SEQ_TRACE_STRICT_MON_TIMESTAMP;
  106:         monotonic_timestamp ->
  107:             BaseOpts bor ?SEQ_TRACE_MON_TIMESTAMP
  108:         end,
  109:     ct:pal("Type ~p, flags = ~p~n", [TsType, Flags]),
  110:     Self = self(),
  111:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  112:     %% Test that initial seq_trace is disabled
  113:     [] = seq_trace:get_token(),
  114:     %% Test setting and reading the different fields
  115:     0 = seq_trace:set_token(label,{my_label,1}),
  116:     {label,{my_label,1}} = seq_trace:get_token(label),
  117:     false = seq_trace:set_token(print,true),
  118:     {print,true} = seq_trace:get_token(print),
  119:     false = seq_trace:set_token(send,true),
  120:     {send,true} = seq_trace:get_token(send),
  121:     false = seq_trace:set_token('receive',true),
  122:     {'receive',true} = seq_trace:get_token('receive'),
  123:     false = seq_trace:set_token(TsType,true),
  124:     {TsType,true} = seq_trace:get_token(TsType),
  125:     %% Check the whole token
  126:     {Flags,{my_label,1},0,Self,0} = seq_trace:get_token(), % all flags are set
  127:     %% Test setting and reading the 'serial' field
  128:     {0,0} = seq_trace:set_token(serial,{3,5}),
  129:     {serial,{3,5}} = seq_trace:get_token(serial),
  130:     %% Check the whole token, test that a whole token can be set and get
  131:     {Flags,{my_label,1},5,Self,3} = seq_trace:get_token(),
  132:     seq_trace:set_token({Flags,19,7,Self,5}),
  133:     {Flags,19,7,Self,5} = seq_trace:get_token(),
  134:     %% Check that receive timeout does not reset token
  135:     receive after 0 -> ok end,
  136:     {Flags,19,7,Self,5} = seq_trace:get_token(),
  137:     %% Check that token can be unset
  138:     {Flags,19,7,Self,5} = seq_trace:set_token([]),
  139:     [] = seq_trace:get_token(),
  140:     %% Check that Previous serial counter survived unset token
  141:     0 = seq_trace:set_token(label, 17),
  142:     {0,17,0,Self,5} = seq_trace:get_token(),
  143:     %% Check that reset_trace resets the token and clears
  144:     %% the Previous serial counter
  145:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  146:     [] = seq_trace:get_token(),
  147:     0 = seq_trace:set_token(label, 19),
  148:     {0,19,0,Self,0} = seq_trace:get_token(),
  149:     %% Cleanup
  150:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  151:     ok.
  152: 
  153: tracer_set_get(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  154:     Self = self(),
  155:     seq_trace:set_system_tracer(self()),
  156:     Self = seq_trace:get_system_tracer(),
  157:     Self = seq_trace:set_system_tracer(false),
  158:     false = seq_trace:get_system_tracer(),
  159: 
  160:     %% Set the system tracer to a port.
  161: 
  162:     Port = load_tracer(Config),
  163:     seq_trace:set_system_tracer(Port),
  164:     Port = seq_trace:get_system_tracer(),
  165:     Port = seq_trace:set_system_tracer(false),
  166:     false = seq_trace:get_system_tracer(),
  167:     ok.
  168: 
  169: print(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  170:     [do_print(TsType, Label) || TsType <- ?TIMESTAMP_MODES,
  171:                                 Label <- [17, "label"]].
  172:     
  173: do_print(TsType, Label) ->
  174:     start_tracer(),
  175:     seq_trace:set_token(label, Label),
  176:     set_token_flags([print, TsType]),
  177:     seq_trace:print(Label,print1),
  178:     seq_trace:print(1,print2),
  179:     seq_trace:print(print3),
  180:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  181:     [{Label,{print,_,_,[],print1}, Ts0},
  182:      {Label,{print,_,_,[],print3}, Ts1}] = stop_tracer(2),
  183:     check_ts(TsType, Ts0),
  184:     check_ts(TsType, Ts1).
  185: 
  186: send(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  187:     lists:foreach(fun do_send/1, ?TIMESTAMP_MODES).
  188: 
  189: do_send(TsType) ->
  190:     do_send(TsType, send).
  191: 
  192: do_send(TsType, Msg) ->
  193:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  194:     start_tracer(),
  195:     Tester = self(),
  196:     Receiver = spawn(fun () ->
  197:                              A = alias(),
  198:                              Tester ! {alias, A},
  199:                              n_time_receiver(3)
  200:                      end),
  201:     Alias = receive {alias, A} -> A end,
  202:     register(n_time_receiver, Receiver),
  203:     Label = make_ref(),
  204:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Label),
  205:     set_token_flags([send, TsType]),
  206:     Receiver ! Msg,
  207:     n_time_receiver ! Msg,
  208:     Alias ! Msg,
  209:     Self = self(),
  210:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  211:     [{Label,{send,_,Self,Receiver,Msg}, Ts1},
  212:      %% Apparently named local destination process is traced as pid (!?)
  213:      {Label,{send,_,Self,Receiver,Msg}, Ts2},
  214:      {Label,{send,_,Self,Alias,Msg}, Ts3}
  215:     ] = stop_tracer(3),
  216:     check_ts(TsType, Ts1),
  217:     check_ts(TsType, Ts2),
  218:     check_ts(TsType, Ts3).
  219: 
  220: 
  221: %% This testcase tests that we do not segfault when we have a
  222: %% literal as the message and the message is copied onto the
  223: %% heap during a GC.
  224: send_literal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  225:     lists:foreach(fun do_send_literal/1,
  226:                   [atom, make_ref(), ets:new(hej,[]), 1 bsl 64,
  227:                    "gurka", {tuple,test,with,#{}}, #{}]).
  228: 
  229: do_send_literal(Msg) ->
  230:     N = 10000,
  231:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  232:     start_tracer(),
  233:     Label = make_ref(),
  234:     Receiver = spawn_link(fun() -> receive ok -> ok end end),
  235:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Label),
  236:     set_token_flags([send, 'receive', no_timestamp]),
  237:     [Receiver ! Msg || _ <- lists:seq(1, N)],
  238:     erlang:garbage_collect(Receiver),
  239:     [Receiver ! Msg || _ <- lists:seq(1, N)],
  240:     erlang:garbage_collect(Receiver),
  241:     Self = self(),
  242:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  243:     [{Label,{send,_,Self,Receiver,Msg}, Ts} | _] = stop_tracer(N),
  244:     check_ts(no_timestamp, Ts).
  245: 
  246: distributed_send(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  247:     lists:foreach(fun do_distributed_send/1, ?TIMESTAMP_MODES).
  248: 
  249: do_distributed_send(TsType) ->
  250:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  251:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  252:     start_tracer(),
  253:     Tester = self(),
  254:     Receiver = spawn(Node,
  255:                      fun () ->
  256:                              A = alias(),
  257:                              Tester ! {alias, A},
  258:                              n_time_receiver(3)
  259:                      end),
  260:     Alias = receive {alias, A} -> A end,
  261:     true = rpc:call(Node,erlang,register,[n_time_receiver, Receiver]),
  262: 
  263:     %% Make sure complex labels survive the trip.
  264:     Label = make_ref(),
  265:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Label),
  266:     set_token_flags([send,TsType]),
  267: 
  268:     Receiver ! send,
  269:     {n_time_receiver, Node} ! "dsend",
  270:     Alias ! "alias_dsend",
  271: 
  272:     Self = self(),
  273:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  274:     peer:stop(Peer),
  275:     [{Label,{send,_,Self,Receiver,send}, Ts1},
  276:      {Label,{send,_,Self,{n_time_receiver,Node}, "dsend"}, Ts2},
  277:      {Label,{send,_,Self,Alias,"alias_dsend"}, Ts3}
  278:     ] = stop_tracer(3),
  279: 
  280:     check_ts(TsType, Ts1),
  281:     check_ts(TsType, Ts2),
  282:     check_ts(TsType, Ts3).
  283: 
  284: 
  285: recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  286:     lists:foreach(fun do_recv/1, ?TIMESTAMP_MODES).
  287: 
  288: do_recv(TsType) ->
  289:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  290:     start_tracer(),
  291:     Tester = self(),
  292:     Receiver = spawn(fun () ->
  293:                              A = alias([reply]),
  294:                              Tester ! {alias, A},
  295:                              n_time_receiver(2)
  296:                      end),
  297:     Alias = receive {alias, A} -> A end,
  298:     set_token_flags(['receive',TsType]),
  299:     Alias ! 'alias_receive',
  300:     Alias ! 'alias_no_receive',
  301:     Receiver ! 'receive',
  302:     %% let the other process receive the message:
  303:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  304:     Self = self(),
  305:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  306:     [{0,{'receive',_,Self,Receiver,'alias_receive'}, Ts1},
  307:      {0,{'receive',_,Self,Receiver,'receive'}, Ts2}] = stop_tracer(2),
  308:     check_ts(TsType, Ts1),
  309:     check_ts(TsType, Ts2).
  310: 
  311: distributed_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  312:     lists:foreach(fun do_distributed_recv/1, ?TIMESTAMP_MODES).
  313: 
  314: do_distributed_recv(TsType) ->
  315:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  316:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  317:     rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,start_tracer,[]),
  318:     Tester = self(),
  319:     Receiver = spawn(Node,
  320:                      fun () ->
  321:                              A = alias([reply]),
  322:                              Tester ! {alias, A},
  323:                              n_time_receiver(2)
  324:                      end),
  325:     Alias = receive {alias, A} -> A end,
  326: 
  327:     %% Make sure complex labels survive the trip.
  328:     Label = make_ref(),
  329:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Label),
  330:     set_token_flags(['receive',TsType]),
  331: 
  332:     Alias ! 'alias_receive',
  333:     Alias ! 'alias_no_receive',
  334:     Receiver ! 'receive',
  335: 
  336:     %% let the other process receive the message:
  337:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  338:     Self = self(),
  339:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  340:     Result = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,stop_tracer,[2]),
  341:     peer:stop(Peer),
  342:     ok = io:format("~p~n",[Result]),
  343:     [{Label,{'receive',_,Self,Receiver,'alias_receive'}, Ts1},
  344:      {Label,{'receive',_,Self,Receiver,'receive'}, Ts2}] = Result,
  345:     check_ts(TsType, Ts1),
  346:     check_ts(TsType, Ts2).
  347: 
  348: trace_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  349:     lists:foreach(fun do_trace_exit/1, ?TIMESTAMP_MODES).
  350: 
  351: do_trace_exit(TsType) ->
  352:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  353:     start_tracer(),
  354:     Receiver = spawn_link(?MODULE, one_time_receiver, [exit]),
  355:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  356: 
  357:     %% Make sure complex labels survive the trip.
  358:     Label = make_ref(),
  359:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Label),
  360:     set_token_flags([send, TsType]),
  361: 
  362:     Receiver ! {before, exit},
  363:     %% let the other process receive the message:
  364:     receive
  365: 	      {'EXIT', Receiver, {exit, {before, exit}}} ->
  366: 		  seq_trace:set_token([]);
  367: 	      Other ->
  368: 		  seq_trace:set_token([]),
  369: 		  ct:fail({received, Other})
  370: 	  end,
  371:     Self = self(),
  372:     Result = stop_tracer(2),
  373:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  374:     ok = io:format("~p~n", [Result]),
  375:     [{Label, {send, {0,1}, Self, Receiver, {before, exit}}, Ts0},
  376: 	   {Label, {send, {1,2}, Receiver, Self,
  377: 	       {'EXIT', Receiver, {exit, {before, exit}}}}, Ts1}] = Result,
  378:     check_ts(TsType, Ts0),
  379:     check_ts(TsType, Ts1).
  380: 
  381: distributed_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  382:     lists:foreach(fun do_distributed_exit/1, ?TIMESTAMP_MODES).
  383: 
  384: do_distributed_exit(TsType) ->
  385:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  386:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  387:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, start_tracer,[]),
  388:     Receiver = spawn_link(Node, ?MODULE, one_time_receiver, [exit]),
  389:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  390:     set_token_flags([send, TsType]),
  391:     Receiver ! {before, exit},
  392:     %% let the other process receive the message:
  393:     receive
  394: 	      {'EXIT', Receiver, {exit, {before, exit}}} ->
  395: 		  seq_trace:set_token([]);
  396: 	      Other ->
  397: 		  seq_trace:set_token([]),
  398: 		  ct:fail({received, Other})
  399: 	  end,
  400:     Self = self(),
  401:     Result = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [1]),
  402:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  403:     process_flag(trap_exit, false),
  404:     peer:stop(Peer),
  405:     ok = io:format("~p~n", [Result]),
  406:     [{0, {send, {1, 2}, Receiver, Self,
  407: 		{'EXIT', Receiver, {exit, {before, exit}}}}, Ts}] = Result,
  408:     check_ts(TsType, Ts).
  409: 
  410: call(doc) ->
  411:     "Tests special forms {is_seq_trace} and {get_seq_token} "
  412: 	"in trace match specs.";
  413: call(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  414:     Self = self(),
  415:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  416:     TrA = transparent_tracer(),
  417:     1 =
  418: 	erlang:trace(Self, true, 
  419: 		     [call, set_on_spawn, {tracer, TrA(pid)}]),
  420:     1 =
  421: 	erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, call_tracee_1, 1},
  422: 			     [{'_',
  423: 			       [],
  424: 			       [{message, {{{self}, {get_seq_token}}}}]}],
  425: 			     [local]),
  426:     1 =
  427: 	erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, call_tracee_2, 1},
  428: 			     [{'_',
  429: 			      [{is_seq_trace}],
  430: 			      [{message, {{{self}, {get_seq_token}}}}]}],
  431: 			     [local]),
  432:     RefA = make_ref(),
  433:     Pid2A = spawn_link(
  434: 		    fun() ->
  435: 			    receive {_, msg, RefA} -> ok end,
  436: 			    RefA = call_tracee_2(RefA),
  437: 			    Self ! {self(), msg, RefA}
  438: 		   end),
  439:     Pid1A = spawn_link(
  440: 		    fun() ->
  441: 			    receive {_, msg, RefA} -> ok end,
  442: 			    RefA = call_tracee_1(RefA),
  443: 			    Pid2A ! {self(), msg, RefA}
  444: 		    end),
  445:     Pid1A ! {Self, msg, RefA},
  446:     %% The message is passed Self -> Pid1B -> Pid2B -> Self.
  447:     %% Traced functions are called in Pid1B and Pid2B. 
  448:     receive {Pid2A, msg, RefA} -> ok end,
  449:     %% Only call_tracee1 will be traced since the guard for 
  450:     %% call_tracee2 requires a sequential trace. The trace
  451:     %% token is undefined.
  452:     Token2A = [],
  453:     {ok, [{trace, Pid1A, call,
  454: 		 {?MODULE, call_tracee_1, [RefA]},
  455: 		 {Pid1A, Token2A}}]} = 
  456: 	TrA({stop, 1}),
  457: 
  458:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  459: 
  460:     TrB = transparent_tracer(),
  461:     1 =
  462: 	erlang:trace(Self, true, 
  463: 		     [call, set_on_spawn, {tracer, TrB(pid)}]),
  464:     RefB = make_ref(),
  465:     Pid2B = spawn_link(
  466: 		    fun() ->
  467: 			    receive {_, msg, RefB} -> ok end,
  468: 			    RefB = call_tracee_2(RefB),
  469: 			    Self ! {self(), msg, RefB}
  470: 		   end),
  471:     Pid1B = spawn_link(
  472: 		    fun() ->
  473: 			    receive {_, msg, RefB} -> ok end,
  474: 			    RefB = call_tracee_1(RefB),
  475: 			    Pid2B ! {self(), msg, RefB}
  476: 		    end),
  477: 
  478:     %% The token is set *AFTER* spawning to make sure we're testing that the
  479:     %% token follows on send and not that it inherits on spawn.
  480:     Label = 17,
  481:     seq_trace:set_token(label, Label),
  482: 
  483:     Pid1B ! {Self, msg, RefB},
  484:     %% The message is passed Self -> Pid1B -> Pid2B -> Self, and the 
  485:     %% seq_trace token follows invisibly. Traced functions are 
  486:     %% called in Pid1B and Pid2B. Seq_trace flags == 0 so no
  487:     %% seq_trace messages are generated.
  488:     receive {Pid2B, msg, RefB} -> ok end,
  489:     %% The values of these counters {.., 1, _, 0}, {.., 2, _, 1}
  490:     %% depend on that seq_trace has been reset just before this test.
  491:     Token1B = {0, Label, 1, Self, 0},
  492:     Token2B = {0, Label, 2, Pid1B, 1},
  493:     {ok, [{trace, Pid1B, call,
  494: 		 {?MODULE, call_tracee_1, [RefB]},
  495: 		 {Pid1B, Token1B}},
  496: 		{trace, Pid2B, call, 
  497: 		 {?MODULE, call_tracee_2, [RefB]},
  498: 		 {Pid2B, Token2B}}]} =
  499: 	TrB({stop,2}),
  500:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  501:     ok.
  502: 
  503: %% The token should follow spawn, just like it follows messages.
  504: inherit_on_spawn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  505:     lists:foreach(
  506:       fun (Test) ->
  507:               lists:foreach(
  508:                 fun (TraceFlags) ->
  509:                         inherit_on_spawn_test(Test, TraceFlags)
  510:                 end,
  511:                 combinations(spawn_trace_flags()))
  512:       end,
  513:       [spawn, spawn_link, spawn_monitor,
  514:        spawn_opt, spawn_request]),
  515:     ok.
  516: 
  517: inherit_on_spawn_test(Spawn, TraceFlags) ->
  518:     io:format("Testing ~p() with ~p trace flags~n", [Spawn, TraceFlags]),
  519: 
  520:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  521:     start_tracer(),
  522:     start_spawn_tracer(TraceFlags),
  523: 
  524:     Ref = make_ref(),
  525:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Ref),
  526:     set_token_flags([send,'receive',strict_monotonic_timestamp]),
  527: 
  528:     Self = self(),
  529:     GurkaMsg = {gurka,Ref},
  530:     SpawnFun = fun() -> Self ! GurkaMsg, receive after infinity -> ok end end,
  531:     {Other, Tag, KnownReqId, KnownSpawnReply}
  532:         = case Spawn of
  533:               spawn ->
  534:                   {spawn(SpawnFun), spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  535:               spawn_link ->
  536:                   {spawn_link(SpawnFun), spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  537:               spawn_monitor ->
  538:                   {P, _} = spawn_monitor(SpawnFun),
  539:                   {P, spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  540:               spawn_opt ->
  541:                   {spawn_opt(SpawnFun, [link]), spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  542:               spawn_request ->
  543:                   SReply = make_ref(),
  544:                   RID = spawn_request(SpawnFun, [link, {reply_tag, SReply}]),
  545:                   receive
  546:                       {SReply, RID, ok, P} = M ->
  547:                           {P, SReply, RID, M}
  548:                   end
  549:           end,
  550: 
  551:     receive {gurka,Ref} -> ok end,
  552:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  553:     erlang:trace(self(),false,[procs|TraceFlags]),
  554: 
  555:     Sequence = lists:keysort(3, stop_tracer(6)),
  556:     io:format("Sequence: ~p~n", [Sequence]),
  557:     [SSpawnRequest, RSpawnRequest, SSpawnReply, RSpawnReply,
  558:      SGurkaMsg, RGurkaMsg] = Sequence,
  559: 
  560:     %% Spawn request...
  561:      {Ref,
  562:       {send,
  563:        {0,1},
  564:        Self,Other,
  565:        ReqMessage},
  566:       _} = SSpawnRequest,
  567:     
  568:     spawn_request = element(1, ReqMessage),
  569:     ReqId = element(2, ReqMessage),
  570:     case KnownReqId of
  571:         undefined -> ok;
  572:         ReqId -> ok
  573:     end,
  574: 
  575:      {Ref,
  576:       {'receive',
  577:        {0,1},
  578:        Self,Other,
  579:        ReqMessage},
  580:       _} = RSpawnRequest,
  581: 
  582:     %% Spawn reply...
  583:     SpawnReply = {Tag,ReqId,ok,Other},
  584:     {Ref,
  585:      {send,
  586:       {1,2},
  587:       Other,Self,
  588:       SpawnReply},
  589:      _} = SSpawnReply,
  590: 
  591:     case KnownSpawnReply of
  592:         undefined -> ok;
  593:         SpawnReply -> ok
  594:     end,
  595: 
  596:     {Ref,
  597:      {'receive',
  598:       {1,2},
  599:       Other,Self,
  600:       SpawnReply},
  601:      _} = RSpawnReply,
  602: 
  603:      %% Gurka message...
  604:      {Ref,
  605:       {send,
  606:        {1,3},
  607:        Other, Self,
  608:        GurkaMsg},
  609:       _} = SGurkaMsg,
  610: 
  611:      {Ref,
  612:       {'receive',
  613:        {1,3},
  614:        Other, Self,
  615:        GurkaMsg},
  616:       _} = RGurkaMsg,
  617: 
  618: 
  619:     Links = not(spawn =:= spawn orelse Spawn =:= spawn_monitor),
  620:     SoL = lists:member(set_on_link,TraceFlags) orelse
  621:         lists:member(set_on_first_link,TraceFlags),
  622:     SoS = lists:member(set_on_spawn,TraceFlags) orelse
  623:         lists:member(set_on_first_sapwn,TraceFlags),
  624: 
  625:     NoTraceMessages =
  626:         if
  627:             SoS andalso Links ->
  628:                 4;
  629:             SoS andalso not Links ->
  630:                 2;
  631:             SoL andalso Links ->
  632:                 4;
  633:             SoL andalso not Links->
  634:                 1;
  635:             Links andalso not SoL andalso not SoS ->
  636:                 2;
  637:             not Links andalso not SoL andalso not SoS ->
  638:                 1
  639:         end,
  640: 
  641:     TraceMessages = stop_spawn_tracer(NoTraceMessages),
  642: 
  643:     unlink(Other),
  644:     exit(Other, kill),
  645: 
  646: 
  647:     ok.
  648: 
  649: inherit_on_dist_spawn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  650:     lists:foreach(fun (Test) ->
  651:                           inherit_on_dist_spawn_test(Test)
  652:                   end,
  653:                   [spawn, spawn_link, spawn_monitor,
  654:                    spawn_opt, spawn_request]),
  655:     ok.
  656: 
  657: inherit_on_dist_spawn_test(Spawn) ->
  658:     io:format("Testing ~p()~n", [Spawn]),
  659:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  660:     %% ensure module is loaded on remote node...
  661:     _ = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, module_info, []),
  662: 
  663:     io:format("Self=~p~n",[self()]),
  664: 
  665:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  666:     start_tracer(),
  667:     rpc:call(Node, seq_trace, reset_trace, []),
  668:     start_tracer(Node),
  669: 
  670:     Ref = make_ref(),
  671:     io:format("Ref=~p~n",[Ref]),
  672: 
  673:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Ref),
  674:     set_token_flags([send,'receive',strict_monotonic_timestamp]),
  675: 
  676:     Self = self(),
  677: 
  678:     GurkaMsg = {gurka,Ref},
  679:     SpawnFun = fun() -> Self ! GurkaMsg, receive after infinity -> ok end end,
  680:     {Other, Tag, KnownReqId, KnownSpawnReply}
  681:         = case Spawn of
  682:               spawn ->
  683:                   {spawn(Node, SpawnFun), spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  684:               spawn_link ->
  685:                   {spawn_link(Node, SpawnFun), spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  686:               spawn_monitor ->
  687:                   {P, _} = spawn_monitor(Node, SpawnFun),
  688:                   {P, spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  689:               spawn_opt ->
  690:                   {spawn_opt(Node, SpawnFun, [link]), spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  691:               spawn_request ->
  692:                   SReply = make_ref(),
  693:                   RID = spawn_request(Node, SpawnFun, [{reply_tag, SReply}, link]),
  694:                   receive
  695:                       {SReply, RID, ok, P} = M ->
  696:                           {P, SReply, RID, M}
  697:                   end
  698:           end,
  699: 
  700:     receive GurkaMsg -> ok end,
  701:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  702: 
  703:     Sequence = lists:keysort(3,stop_tracer(4)),
  704:     io:format("Sequence: ~p~n", [Sequence]),
  705:     [StSpawnRequest, StAList, StSpawnReply, StGurkaMsg] = Sequence,
  706: 
  707:     %% Spawn request...
  708:      {Ref,
  709:       {send,
  710:        {0,1},
  711:        Self,Node,
  712:        ReqMessage},
  713:       _} = StSpawnRequest,
  714:     
  715:     spawn_request = element(1, ReqMessage),
  716:     ReqId = element(2, ReqMessage),
  717:     case KnownReqId of
  718:         undefined -> ok;
  719:         ReqId -> ok
  720:     end,
  721: 
  722:     {Ref,
  723:      {send,
  724:       {0,2},
  725:       Self,Node,
  726:       ArgList},
  727:      _} = StAList,
  728: 
  729:     %% Spawn reply...
  730:     SpawnReply = {Tag,ReqId,ok,Other},
  731:     case KnownSpawnReply of
  732:         undefined -> ok;
  733:         SpawnReply -> ok
  734:     end,
  735: 
  736:     {Ref,
  737:      {'receive',
  738:       {1,2},
  739:       Other,Self,
  740:       SpawnReply},
  741:      _} = StSpawnReply,
  742: 
  743:      %% Gurka message...
  744:      {Ref,
  745:       {'receive',
  746:        {2,3},
  747:        Other, Self,
  748:        GurkaMsg},
  749:       _} = StGurkaMsg,
  750: 
  751:     SequenceNode = lists:keysort(3,stop_tracer(Node, 4)),
  752:     io:format("SequenceNode: ~p~n", [SequenceNode]),
  753:     [StSpawnRequestNode, StSpawnReplyNode, StAListNode, StGurkaMsgNode] = SequenceNode,
  754: 
  755: 
  756:     %% Spawn request...
  757:      {Ref,
  758:       {'receive',
  759:        {0,1},
  760:        Self,Other,
  761:        ReqMessage},
  762:       _} = StSpawnRequestNode,
  763: 
  764:     %% Spawn reply...
  765:     {Ref,
  766:      {send,
  767:       {1,2},
  768:       Other,Self,
  769:       {spawn_reply, ReqId, ok, Other}},
  770:      _} = StSpawnReplyNode,
  771: 
  772:     {Ref,
  773:      {'receive',
  774:       {0,2},
  775:       Self,Other,
  776:       ArgList},
  777:      _} = StAListNode,
  778: 
  779:      %% Gurka message...
  780:      {Ref,
  781:       {send,
  782:        {2,3},
  783:        Other, Self,
  784:        GurkaMsg},
  785:       _} = StGurkaMsgNode,
  786: 
  787:     unlink(Other),
  788: 
  789:     peer:stop(Peer),
  790: 
  791:     ok.
  792: 
  793: dist_spawn_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  794:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  795:     %% ensure module is loaded on remote node...
  796:     _ = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, module_info, []),
  797: 
  798:     io:format("Self=~p~n",[self()]),
  799: 
  800:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  801:     start_tracer(),
  802:     rpc:call(Node, seq_trace, reset_trace, []),
  803:     start_tracer(Node),
  804: 
  805:     Ref = make_ref(),
  806:     io:format("Ref=~p~n",[Ref]),
  807: 
  808:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Ref),
  809:     set_token_flags([send,'receive',strict_monotonic_timestamp]),
  810: 
  811:     Self = self(),
  812:     SpawnReplyTag = make_ref(),
  813:     GurkaMsg = {gurka,Ref},
  814:     ReqId = spawn_request(Node,
  815:                           fun () ->
  816:                                   Self ! GurkaMsg,
  817:                                   receive after infinity -> ok end
  818:                           end,
  819:                           [lunk, {reply_tag, SpawnReplyTag}, link]),
  820: 
  821:     receive
  822:         {SpawnReplyTag, ReqId, ResType, Err} ->
  823:             error = ResType,
  824:             badopt = Err
  825:     end,
  826: 
  827:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  828: 
  829:     Sequence = lists:keysort(3,stop_tracer(3)),
  830:     io:format("Sequence: ~p~n", [Sequence]),
  831:     [StSpawnRequest, StAList, StSpawnReply] = Sequence,
  832: 
  833:     %% Spawn request...
  834:      {Ref,
  835:       {send,
  836:        {0,1},
  837:        Self,Node,
  838:        ReqMessage},
  839:       _} = StSpawnRequest,
  840:     
  841:     spawn_request = element(1, ReqMessage),
  842:     ReqId = element(2, ReqMessage),
  843: 
  844:     {Ref,
  845:      {send,
  846:       {0,2},
  847:       Self,Node,
  848:       _ArgList},
  849:      _} = StAList,
  850: 
  851:     %% Spawn reply...
  852:     ReplyMessage = {SpawnReplyTag,ReqId,error,badopt},
  853:     {Ref,
  854:      {'receive',
  855:       {1,2},
  856:       Node,Self,
  857:       ReplyMessage},
  858:      _} = StSpawnReply,
  859: 
  860:     SequenceNode = lists:keysort(3,stop_tracer(Node, 2)),
  861:     io:format("SequenceNode: ~p~n", [SequenceNode]),
  862:     [StSpawnRequestNode, StSpawnReplyNode] = SequenceNode,
  863: 
  864:     %% Spawn request...
  865:      {Ref,
  866:       {'receive',
  867:        {0,1},
  868:        Self,Node,
  869:        ReqMessage},
  870:       _} = StSpawnRequestNode,
  871: 
  872:     %% Spawn reply...
  873:     {Ref,
  874:      {send,
  875:       {1,2},
  876:       Node,Self,
  877:       {spawn_reply, ReqId, error, badopt}},
  878:      _} = StSpawnReplyNode,
  879: 
  880:     peer:stop(Peer),
  881: 
  882:     ok.
  883: 
  884: 
  885: %% Send trace messages to a port.
  886: port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  887:     lists:foreach(fun (TsType) -> do_port(TsType, Config) end,
  888: 		  ?TIMESTAMP_MODES).
  889: 
  890: do_port(TsType, Config) ->
  891:     io:format("Testing ~p~n",[TsType]),
  892:     Port = load_tracer(Config),
  893:     seq_trace:set_system_tracer(Port),
  894: 
  895:     set_token_flags([print, TsType]),
  896:     Small = [small,term],
  897:     seq_trace:print(0, Small),
  898:     case get_port_message(Port) of
  899: 	      {seq_trace,0,{print,_,_,[],Small}} when TsType == no_timestamp ->
  900: 		  ok;
  901: 	      {seq_trace,0,{print,_,_,[],Small},Ts0} when TsType /= no_timestamp ->
  902: 		  check_ts(TsType, Ts0),
  903: 		  ok;
  904: 	      Other ->
  905: 		  seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  906: 		  ct:fail({unexpected,Other})
  907: 	  end,
  908:     %% OTP-4218 Messages from ports should not affect seq trace token.
  909:     %%
  910:     %% Check if trace token still is active on this process after
  911:     %% the get_port_message/1 above that receives from a port.
  912:     OtherSmall = [other | Small],
  913:     seq_trace:print(0, OtherSmall),
  914:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  915:     case get_port_message(Port) of
  916: 	      {seq_trace,0,{print,_,_,[],OtherSmall}} when TsType == no_timestamp ->
  917: 		  ok;
  918: 	      {seq_trace,0,{print,_,_,[],OtherSmall}, Ts1} when TsType /= no_timestamp ->
  919: 		  check_ts(TsType, Ts1),
  920: 		  ok;
  921: 	      Other1 ->
  922: 		  ct:fail({unexpected,Other1})
  923: 	  end,
  924: 
  925: 
  926:     seq_trace:set_token(print, true),
  927:     Huge = huge_data(),
  928:     seq_trace:print(0, Huge),
  929:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  930:     case get_port_message(Port) of
  931: 	      {seq_trace,0,{print,_,_,[],Huge}} ->
  932: 		  ok;
  933: 	      Other2 ->
  934: 		  ct:fail({unexpected,Other2})
  935: 	  end,
  936:     unlink(Port),
  937:     exit(Port,kill),
  938:     ok.
  939: 
  940: get_port_message(Port) ->
  941:     receive
  942: 	{Port,{data,Bin}} when is_binary(Bin) ->
  943: 	    binary_to_term(Bin);
  944: 	Other ->
  945: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Other})
  946:     after 5000 ->
  947: 	    ct:fail(timeout)
  948:     end.
  949: 
  950: 
  951: %% OTP-15849 ERL-700
  952: %% Verify changing label on existing token when it resides on old heap.
  953: %% Bug caused faulty ref from old to new heap.
  954: old_heap_token(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  955:     seq_trace:set_token(label, 1),
  956:     erlang:garbage_collect(self(), [{type, minor}]),
  957:     erlang:garbage_collect(self(), [{type, minor}]),
  958:     %% Now token tuple should be on old-heap.
  959:     %% Set a new non-literal label which should reside on new-heap.
  960:     NewLabel = {self(), "new label"},
  961:     1 = seq_trace:set_token(label, NewLabel),
  962: 
  963:     %% If bug, we now have a ref from old to new heap. Yet another minor gc
  964:     %% will make that a ref to deallocated memory.
  965:     erlang:garbage_collect(self(), [{type, minor}]),
  966:     {label,NewLabel} = seq_trace:get_token(label),
  967:     ok.
  968: 
  969: %% Verify changing label on existing token when it resides on mature heap.
  970: %% Bug caused faulty ref from old to new heap.
  971: mature_heap_token(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  972: 
  973:     seq_trace:set_token(label, 1),
  974:     erlang:garbage_collect(self(), [{type, minor}]),
  975:     %% Now token should be on mature heap
  976:     %% Set a new non-literal label which should reside on new-heap.
  977:     NewLabel = {self(), "new label"},
  978:     seq_trace:set_token(label, NewLabel),
  979: 
  980:     %% If bug, we now have a ref from mature to new heap. If we now GC
  981:     %% twice the token will refer to deallocated memory.
  982:     erlang:garbage_collect(self(), [{type, minor}]),
  983:     erlang:garbage_collect(self(), [{type, minor}]),
  984:     {label,NewLabel} = seq_trace:get_token(label),
  985:     ok.
  986: 
  987: 
  988: match_set_seq_token(doc) ->
  989:     ["Tests that match spec function set_seq_token does not "
  990:      "corrupt the heap"];
  991: match_set_seq_token(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  992:     Parent = self(),
  993: 
  994:     %% OTP-4222 Match spec 'set_seq_token' corrupts heap
  995:     %%
  996:     %% This test crashes the emulator if the bug in question is present,
  997:     %% it is therefore done in a slave node.
  998:     %%
  999:     %% All the timeout stuff is here to get decent accuracy of the error
 1000:     %% return value, instead of just 'timeout'.
 1001:     %%
 1002:     {ok, Peer, Sandbox} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1003:     true = rpc:call(Sandbox, code, add_patha,
 1004: 			  [filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 1005:     Lbl = 4711,
 1006:     %% Do the possibly crashing test
 1007:     P1 =
 1008: 	spawn(
 1009: 	  fun () ->
 1010: 		  Parent ! {self(),
 1011: 			    rpc:call(Sandbox, 
 1012: 				     ?MODULE, do_match_set_seq_token, [Lbl])}
 1013: 	  end),
 1014:     %% Probe the node with a simple rpc request, to see if it is alive.
 1015:     P2 =
 1016: 	spawn(
 1017: 	  fun () ->
 1018: 		  receive after 4000 -> ok end,
 1019: 		  Parent ! {self(), rpc:call(Sandbox, erlang, abs, [-1])}
 1020: 	  end),
 1021:     %% If the test node hangs completely, this timer expires.
 1022:     R3 = erlang:start_timer(8000, self(), void),
 1023:     %%
 1024:     {ok, Log} =
 1025: 	receive
 1026: 	    {P1, Result} ->
 1027: 		exit(P2, done),
 1028: 		erlang:cancel_timer(R3),
 1029: 		Result;
 1030: 	    {P2, 1} ->
 1031: 		exit(P1, timeout),
 1032: 		erlang:cancel_timer(R3),
 1033: 		{error, "Test process hung"};
 1034: 	    {timeout, R3, _} ->
 1035: 		exit(P1, timeout),
 1036: 		exit(P2, timeout),
 1037: 		{error, "Test node hung"}
 1038: 	end,
 1039: 
 1040:     %% Sort the log on Pid, as events from different processes
 1041:     %% are not guaranteed to arrive in a certain order to the
 1042:     %% tracer
 1043:     SortedLog = lists:keysort(2, Log),
 1044: 
 1045:     ok = check_match_set_seq_token_log(Lbl, SortedLog),
 1046:     %%
 1047:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1048:     ok.
 1049: 
 1050: %% OTP-4222 Match spec 'set_seq_token' corrupts heap
 1051: %%
 1052: %% The crashing test goes as follows:
 1053: %%
 1054: %% One trigger function calls match spec function {set_seq_token, _, _},
 1055: %% which when faulty corrupts the heap. It is assured that the process
 1056: %% in question has a big heap and recently garbage collected so there 
 1057: %% will be room on the heap, which is necessary for the crash to happen.
 1058: %%
 1059: %% Then two processes bounces a few messages between each other, and if
 1060: %% the heap is crashed the emulator crashes, or the triggering process's
 1061: %% loop data gets corrupted so the loop never ends.
 1062: do_match_set_seq_token(Label) ->
 1063:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
 1064:     Tr = transparent_tracer(),
 1065:     TrPid = Tr(pid),
 1066:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, 
 1067: 			 [{'_', 
 1068: 			   [{is_seq_trace}], 
 1069: 			   [{message, {get_seq_token}}]}], 
 1070: 			 [local]),
 1071:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, countdown, 2}, 
 1072: 			 [{'_', 
 1073: 			   [], 
 1074: 			   [{set_seq_token, label, Label},
 1075: 			    {message, {get_seq_token}}]}],
 1076: 			 [local]),
 1077:     erlang:trace(new, true, [call, {tracer, TrPid}]),
 1078:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1079:     Bounce = spawn(fun () -> bounce(Ref) end),
 1080:     Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Bounce),
 1081:     _Countdown = erlang:spawn_opt(?MODULE, countdown_start, [Bounce, Ref],
 1082: 				 [{min_heap_size, 4192}]),
 1083:     receive 
 1084: 	{'DOWN', Mref, _, _, normal} -> 
 1085: 	    Result = Tr({stop, 0}),
 1086: 	    seq_trace:reset_trace(),
 1087: 	    erlang:trace(new, false, [call]),
 1088: 	    Result;
 1089: 	{'DOWN', Mref, _, _, Reason} ->
 1090: 	    Tr({stop, 0}),
 1091: 	    seq_trace:reset_trace(),
 1092: 	    erlang:trace(new, false, [call]),
 1093: 	    {error, Reason}
 1094:     end.
 1095: 
 1096: check_match_set_seq_token_log(
 1097:   Label,
 1098:   [{trace,B,call,{?MODULE,bounce,   [Ref]},    {0,Label,2,B,1}},
 1099:    {trace,B,call,{?MODULE,bounce,   [Ref]},    {0,Label,4,B,3}},
 1100:    {trace,B,call,{?MODULE,bounce,   [Ref]},    {0,Label,6,B,5}},
 1101:    {trace,C,call,{?MODULE,countdown,[B,Ref]},  {0,Label,0,C,0}},
 1102:    {trace,C,call,{?MODULE,countdown,[B,Ref,3]},{0,Label,0,C,0}},
 1103:    {trace,C,call,{?MODULE,countdown,[B,Ref,2]},{0,Label,2,B,1}},
 1104:    {trace,C,call,{?MODULE,countdown,[B,Ref,1]},{0,Label,4,B,3}},
 1105:    {trace,C,call,{?MODULE,countdown,[B,Ref,0]},{0,Label,6,B,5}}
 1106:   ]) ->
 1107:     ok;
 1108: check_match_set_seq_token_log(_Label, Log) ->
 1109:     {error, Log}.
 1110: 
 1111: countdown_start(Bounce, Ref) ->
 1112:     %% This gc and the increased heap size of this process ensures that
 1113:     %% the match spec executed for countdown/2 has got heap space for
 1114:     %% the trace token, so the heap gets trashed according to OTP-4222.
 1115:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1116:     countdown(Bounce, Ref).
 1117: 
 1118: countdown(Bounce, Ref) ->
 1119:     countdown(Bounce, Ref, 3).
 1120: 
 1121: countdown(Bounce, Ref, 0) ->
 1122:     Bounce ! Ref;
 1123: countdown(Bounce, Ref, Cnt) ->
 1124:     Tag = make_ref(),
 1125:     Bounce ! {Ref, self(), {Tag, Cnt}},
 1126:     receive {Tag, Cnt} -> countdown(Bounce, Ref, Cnt-1) end.
 1127: 
 1128: bounce(Ref) ->
 1129:     receive 
 1130: 	Ref ->
 1131: 	    ok;
 1132: 	{Ref, Dest, Msg} ->
 1133: 	    Dest ! Msg,
 1134: 	    bounce(Ref)
 1135:     end.
 1136: 
 1137: 
 1138: 
 1139: gc_seq_token(doc) ->
 1140:     ["Tests that a seq_trace token on a message in the inqueue ",
 1141:      "can be garbage collected."];
 1142: gc_seq_token(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1143:     Parent = self(),
 1144: 
 1145:     %% OTP-4555 Seq trace token causes free mem read in gc
 1146:     %%
 1147:     %% This test crashes the emulator if the bug in question is present,
 1148:     %% it is therefore done in a slave node.
 1149:     %%
 1150:     %% All the timeout stuff is here to get decent accuracy of the error
 1151:     %% return value, instead of just 'timeout'.
 1152:     %%
 1153:     {ok, Peer, Sandbox} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1154:     true = rpc:call(Sandbox, code, add_patha,
 1155: 			  [filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 1156:     Label = 4711,
 1157:     %% Do the possibly crashing test
 1158:     P1 =
 1159: 	spawn(
 1160: 	  fun () ->
 1161:  		  Parent ! {self(),
 1162: 			    rpc:call(Sandbox, 
 1163: 				     ?MODULE, do_gc_seq_token, [Label])}
 1164: 	  end),
 1165:     %% Probe the node with a simple rpc request, to see if it is alive.
 1166:     P2 =
 1167: 	spawn(
 1168: 	  fun () ->
 1169: 		  receive after 4000 -> ok end,
 1170: 		  Parent ! {self(), rpc:call(Sandbox, erlang, abs, [-1])}
 1171: 	  end),
 1172:     %% If the test node hangs completely, this timer expires.
 1173:     R3 = erlang:start_timer(8000, self(), void),
 1174:     %%
 1175:     ok =
 1176: 	receive
 1177: 	    {P1, Result} ->
 1178: 		exit(P2, done),
 1179: 		erlang:cancel_timer(R3),
 1180: 		Result;
 1181: 	    {P2, 1} ->
 1182: 		exit(P1, timeout),
 1183: 		erlang:cancel_timer(R3),
 1184: 		{error, "Test process hung"};
 1185: 	    {timeout, R3, _} ->
 1186: 		exit(P1, timeout),
 1187: 		exit(P2, timeout),
 1188: 		{error, "Test node hung"}
 1189: 	end,
 1190:     %%
 1191:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1192:     ok.
 1193: 
 1194: do_gc_seq_token(Label) ->
 1195:     Parent = self(),
 1196:     Comment =       
 1197: 	{"OTP-4555 Seq trace token causes free mem read in gc\n"
 1198: 	 "\n"
 1199: 	 "The crashing test goes as follows:\n"
 1200: 	 "\n"
 1201: 	 "Put a message with seq_trace token in the inqueue,\n"
 1202: 	 "Grow the process heap big enough to become mmap'ed\n"
 1203: 	 "and force a garbage collection using large terms\n"
 1204: 	 "to get a test_heap instruction with a big size value.\n"
 1205: 	 "Then try to trick the heap into shrinking.\n"
 1206: 	 "\n"
 1207: 	 "All this to make the GC move the heap between memory blocks.\n"},
 1208:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
 1209:     Child = spawn_link(
 1210: 	      fun() ->
 1211: 		      receive {Parent, no_seq_trace_token} -> ok end,
 1212: 		      do_grow(Comment, 256*1024, []),
 1213: 		      do_shrink(10),
 1214: 		      receive {Parent, seq_trace_token} -> ok end,
 1215: 		      Parent ! {self(), {token, seq_trace:get_token(label)}}
 1216: 	      end),
 1217:     seq_trace:set_token(label, Label),
 1218:     Child ! {Parent, seq_trace_token},
 1219:     seq_trace:set_token([]),
 1220:     Child ! {Parent, no_seq_trace_token},
 1221:     receive 
 1222: 	{Child, {token, {label, Label}}} -> 
 1223: 	    ok;
 1224: 	{Child, {token, Other}} ->
 1225: 	    {error, Other}
 1226:     end.
 1227: 
 1228: do_grow(_, 0, Acc) ->
 1229:     Acc;
 1230: do_grow(E, N, Acc) ->
 1231:     do_grow(E, N-1, [E | Acc]).
 1232: 
 1233: do_shrink(0) ->
 1234:     ok;
 1235: do_shrink(N) ->
 1236:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1237:     do_shrink(N-1).
 1238: 
 1239: %% Test that messages from a port does not clear the token
 1240: port_clean_token(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1241:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
 1242:     Label = make_ref(),
 1243:     seq_trace:set_token(label, Label),
 1244:     {label,Label} = seq_trace:get_token(label),
 1245: 
 1246:     %% Create a port and get messages from it
 1247:     %% We use os:cmd as a convenience as it does
 1248:     %% open_port, port_command, port_close and receives replies.
 1249:     %% Maybe it is not ideal to rely on the internal implementation
 1250:     %% of os:cmd but it will have to do.
 1251:     os:cmd("ls"),
 1252: 
 1253:     %% Make sure that the seq_trace token is still there
 1254:     {label,Label} = seq_trace:get_token(label),
 1255: 
 1256:     ok.
 1257: 
 1258: 
 1259: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1260: %% Internal help functions
 1261: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1262: 
 1263: %% Call trace targets
 1264: 
 1265: call_tracee_1(X) ->
 1266:     X.
 1267: 
 1268: call_tracee_2(X) ->
 1269:     X.
 1270: 
 1271: 
 1272: transparent_tracer() ->
 1273:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1274:     Loop = 
 1275: 	fun(Fun, Log, LN) ->
 1276: 		receive
 1277: 		    {stop, MinLN, Ref, From} when LN >= MinLN ->
 1278: 			From ! {log, Ref, lists:reverse(Log)};
 1279: 		    Entry when is_tuple(Entry) == false; element(1, Entry) /= stop ->
 1280: 			Fun(Fun, [Entry | Log], LN+1)
 1281: 		end
 1282: 	end,
 1283:     Self = self(),
 1284:     Pid = 
 1285: 	spawn(fun() ->
 1286: 		      seq_trace:set_system_tracer(self()),
 1287: 		      Self ! {started, Ref},
 1288: 		      Loop(Loop, [], 0) 
 1289: 	      end),
 1290:     receive {started, Ref} -> ok end,
 1291:     fun(pid) ->
 1292: 	    Pid;
 1293:        ({stop, N}) when is_integer(N), N >= 0 ->
 1294: 	    Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 1295: 	    receive
 1296: 		{'DOWN', Mref, _, _, _} ->
 1297: 		    {error, not_started}
 1298: 	    after 0 ->
 1299: 		    DeliverRef = erlang:trace_delivered(all),
 1300: 		    receive
 1301: 			{trace_delivered,_,DeliverRef} -> ok
 1302: 		    end,
 1303: 		    Pid ! {stop, N, Ref, self()},
 1304: 		    receive {'DOWN', Mref, _, _, _} -> ok end,
 1305: 		    receive {log, Ref, Log} -> 
 1306: 			    {ok, Log} 
 1307: 		    end
 1308: 	    end
 1309:     end.
 1310: 
 1311: n_time_receiver(0) ->
 1312:     ok;
 1313: n_time_receiver(N) ->
 1314:     receive _Term -> n_time_receiver(N-1)
 1315:     end.
 1316: 
 1317: one_time_receiver() ->
 1318:     receive _Term -> ok
 1319:     end.
 1320: 	
 1321: one_time_receiver(exit) ->
 1322:     receive Term ->
 1323: 	    exit({exit, Term}) 
 1324:     end.
 1325: 
 1326: simple_tracer(Data, DN) ->
 1327:     receive
 1328: 	{seq_trace,Label,Info,Ts} ->
 1329: 	    simple_tracer([{Label,Info,Ts}|Data], DN+1);
 1330: 	{seq_trace,Label,Info} ->
 1331: 	    simple_tracer([{Label,Info, no_timestamp}|Data], DN+1);
 1332: 	{stop,N,From} when DN >= N ->
 1333: 	    From ! {tracerlog,lists:reverse(Data)}
 1334:     end.
 1335: 
 1336: stop_tracer(N) when is_integer(N) ->
 1337:     stop_tracer(node(), N).
 1338: 
 1339: stop_tracer(Node, N) when is_integer(N) ->
 1340:     case rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[seq_trace_SUITE_tracer]) of
 1341:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1342:             unlink(Pid),
 1343:             Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 1344:             Pid ! {stop,N,self()},
 1345:             receive
 1346:                 {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, noproc} ->
 1347:                     {error, not_started};
 1348:                 {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 1349:                     {error, Reason};
 1350:                 {tracerlog,Data} ->
 1351:                     erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush]),
 1352:                     Data
 1353:             after 5000 ->
 1354:                     erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush]),
 1355:                     {error,timeout}
 1356:             end;
 1357:         _ ->
 1358:             {error, not_started}
 1359:     end.
 1360: 
 1361: start_tracer() ->
 1362:     start_tracer(node()).
 1363: 
 1364: start_tracer(Node) ->
 1365:     Me = self(),
 1366:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1367:     Pid = spawn_link(Node,
 1368:                      fun () ->
 1369:                              Self = self(),
 1370:                              stop_tracer(0),
 1371:                              register(seq_trace_SUITE_tracer,Self),
 1372:                              seq_trace:set_system_tracer(Self),
 1373:                              Self = seq_trace:get_system_tracer(),
 1374:                              Me ! Ref,
 1375:                              simple_tracer([], 0)
 1376:                      end),
 1377:     receive
 1378:         Ref ->
 1379:             unlink(Pid),
 1380:             Pid
 1381:     end.
 1382: 
 1383: set_token_flags([]) ->
 1384:     ok;
 1385: set_token_flags([no_timestamp|Flags]) ->
 1386:     seq_trace:set_token(timestamp, false),
 1387:     seq_trace:set_token(monotonic_timestamp, false),
 1388:     seq_trace:set_token(strict_monotonic_timestamp, false),
 1389:     set_token_flags(Flags);
 1390: set_token_flags([Flag|Flags]) ->
 1391:     seq_trace:set_token(Flag, true),
 1392:     set_token_flags(Flags).
 1393: 
 1394: start_spawn_tracer(TraceFlags) ->
 1395: 
 1396:     %% Disable old trace flags
 1397:     erlang:trace(self(), false, spawn_trace_flags()),
 1398: 
 1399:     Me = self(),
 1400:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1401:     Pid = spawn_link(
 1402:             fun () ->
 1403:                     register(spawn_tracer, self()),
 1404:                     Me ! Ref,
 1405:                     (fun F(Data) ->
 1406:                              receive
 1407:                                  {get, N, StopRef, Pid} when N =< length(Data) ->
 1408:                                      Pid ! {lists:reverse(Data), StopRef};
 1409:                                  M when element(1,M) =:= trace ->
 1410:                                      F([M|Data])
 1411:                              end
 1412:                     end)([])
 1413:             end),
 1414:     receive
 1415:         Ref ->
 1416:             erlang:trace(self(),true,[{tracer,Pid}, procs | TraceFlags])
 1417:     end.
 1418: 
 1419: stop_spawn_tracer(N) ->
 1420:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1421:     spawn_tracer ! {get, N, Ref, self()},
 1422:     receive
 1423:         {Data, Ref} ->
 1424:             Data
 1425:     end.
 1426: 
 1427: spawn_trace_flags() ->
 1428:     [set_on_spawn, set_on_link, set_on_spawn,
 1429:      set_on_first_link, set_on_first_spawn].
 1430: 
 1431: combinations(Flags) ->
 1432:     %% Do a bit of sofs magic to create a list of lists with
 1433:     %% all the combinations of all the flags above
 1434:     Set = sofs:from_term(Flags),
 1435:     Product = sofs:product(list_to_tuple(lists:duplicate(length(Flags),Set))),
 1436:     Combinations = [lists:usort(tuple_to_list(T)) || T <- sofs:to_external(Product)],
 1437:     [[] | lists:usort(Combinations)].
 1438: 
 1439: check_ts(no_timestamp, Ts) ->
 1440:     try
 1441: 	no_timestamp = Ts
 1442:     catch
 1443: 	_ : _ ->
 1444: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_timestamp, Ts})
 1445:     end,
 1446:     ok;
 1447: check_ts(timestamp, Ts) ->
 1448:     try
 1449: 	{Ms,S,Us} = Ts,
 1450: 	true = is_integer(Ms),
 1451: 	true = is_integer(S),
 1452: 	true = is_integer(Us)
 1453:     catch
 1454: 	_ : _ ->
 1455: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_timestamp, Ts})
 1456:     end,
 1457:     ok;
 1458: check_ts(monotonic_timestamp, Ts) ->
 1459:     try
 1460: 	true = is_integer(Ts)
 1461:     catch
 1462: 	_ : _ ->
 1463: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_timestamp, Ts})
 1464:     end,
 1465:     ok;
 1466: check_ts(strict_monotonic_timestamp, Ts) ->
 1467:     try
 1468: 	{MT, UMI} = Ts,
 1469: 	true = is_integer(MT),
 1470: 	true = is_integer(UMI)
 1471:     catch
 1472: 	_ : _ ->
 1473: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_timestamp, Ts})
 1474:     end,
 1475:     ok.
 1476: 
 1477: load_tracer(Config) ->
 1478:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1479:     ok = erl_ddll:load_driver(Path, echo_drv),
 1480:     open_port({spawn,echo_drv}, [eof,binary]).
 1481: 
 1482: huge_data() -> huge_data(16384).
 1483: huge_data(0) -> [];
 1484: huge_data(N) when N rem 2 == 0 ->
 1485:     P = huge_data(N div 2),
 1486:     [P|P];
 1487: huge_data(N) ->
 1488:     P = huge_data(N div 2),
 1489:     [16#1234566,P|P].
